alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 9:57PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, Whiteside, Jo Daviess, Carroll, Stephenson, eastern Jackson, northeastern Scott, eastern Dubuque and eastern Clinton Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 957 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hazel Green to near Massbach to near Erie. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Freeport, Sterling, Rock Falls, Morrison, Galena, Mount Carroll, Camanche, Fulton, Savanna, Lena, Bellevue, Prophetstown, Stockton, Erie, Lanark, Warren, Garden Plain, Milledgeville and Preston. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 14 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
